Talk03_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Traveling, are we?<sp:0:4:0>Just know that once you cross the
<clr:0000>Tabantha Great Bridge<clr:ffff>, the <clr:0000>west side of
the canyon<clr:ffff> gets rugged. Prep for that!
Talk21:
The Stable Trotters are back in full scale!<sp:5:0:0>
Come enjoy to your heart's content!
WakkaCharm: My, is that a ring garland?
Talk01_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I wonder how the guy with the <clr:0000>horn<clr:ffff> who
crossed <clr:0000>Tabantha Great Bridge<clr:ffff> to bring
music and food to Rito Village is doing.
I hope he's all right.
Talk13:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting>Good on you for working this late.
Welcome to <clr:0000>Tabantha Bridge Stable<clr:ffff>!
Talk01:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Someone did cross the <clr:0000>Tabantha Great
Bridge<clr:ffff> saying, "I'll bring music and food
to Rito Village!"
I wonder how he's doing now...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad>I tried to stop him.<sp:5:0:0> I told him the blizzard
was so dangerous, even seasoned
merchants couldn't reach the village.
But he just picked up his <clr:0000>horn<clr:ffff>, got on
the wagon he'd prepared on the other
side of the bridge, and left.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0300>I hope he didn't stray from the path and
wind up somewhere strange...
Talk01_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Oh no.<sp:5:1:0> That probably isn't going well for
him at all.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0300>He can't get across the bridge that
leads to Rito Village. It's collapsed under
the weight of the snow.
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Trouble>But he's put himself in danger by taking
the <clr:0000>westbound road<clr:ffff> out of here. It's often
much too narrow for wagons.
Worse still, the Upheaval created a
<clr:0000>wide hole <clr:ffff>along the way that'd be very
hard to get past safely...
Talk14:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Good heavens, you're soaking wet! Well,
welcome to <clr:0000>Tabantha Bridge Stable<clr:ffff>! Come
and dry yourself off.
Talk01_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Think>So, your bridge is out because of the
blizzard...<sp:5:1:0>and there's a terrible hole on
the side of the road? 
I should have tried harder to stop him.
Talk03_00_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>You know, just before you came by...<sp:0:4:0>someone crossed <clr:0000>Tabantha Great Bridge<clr:ffff>
saying, "I want to bring music and food to
Rito Village!"
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>I tried to stop him.<sp:5:0:0> I told him the blizzard
was bad around the village and that the
path was dangerous...
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>But he'd already prepared a wagon on the
other side of the bridge. He hopped on
and away he went.
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Think_01>Between the narrow bridge to the village
and the <clr:0000>huge hole<clr:ffff> in the ground,<sp:5:0:0> the
<clr:0000>western road<clr:ffff>'s a tough route for a wagon.
<sp:3:0:2:0301>I should have tried harder to hold him
back...<sp:5:1:0> I just hope he and his <clr:0000>horn<clr:ffff> make
it to Rito Village safely.
Talk01_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sad>Driving a wagon on the westbound road
out of here was hard even before all of
this.<sp:5:0:0> I'm worried for that driver.
Talk03:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>If you have any questions about the area,
you just ask your Auntie Banji!

Just don't expect too much. Out of me,
or the whole region, really.

<sp:3:0:2:0100>I mean, what you see is what you get!
We're out here in the western boonies,
so there's not a lot going on.
Anything new you'll hear or find around
here comes from travelers or merchants
coming down that <clr:0000>road <clr:ffff>there.
Talk03_00_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I think it was just before you came by...<sp:0:4:0>Someone crossed over <clr:0000>Tabantha Great
Bridge<clr:ffff> saying, "I want to bring music and
food to Rito Village!"
I tried warning him, but his wagon was
already prepped on the other side. He just
hopped on and headed off.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>The <clr:0000>western road<clr:ffff> may lead to Rito Village,
but the narrow bridge and <clr:0000>huge hole<clr:ffff> make
it a hard route for a wagon.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Maybe if I asked the guy to play us a song
on his <clr:0000>horn<clr:ffff> before he left, I could have
stopped him...
Talk16:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Ahhh... Oh, welcome to <clr:0000>Tabantha
Bridge Stable<clr:ffff>!<sp:5:0:0>

Why do I look so relaxed? Because the
children are working hard for me! They're
little dears, each and every one.
Near01: The kids are all so reliable.
Talk01_05: <sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad>I should have tried harder to stop him...
Talk04:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>If you're looking for a guide to Tabantha,
you've come to the right gal!

<sp:3:0:2:0101>Even if I did get all my info from random
travelers and merchants who passed
through along the <clr:0000>road<clr:ffff>...
Talk17:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS>Welcome to <clr:0000>Tabantha Bridge Stable<clr:ffff>.<sp:5:0:0>


When I look at a child's sleeping face, it's like the
day's exhaustion simply melts away.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk05:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Yeah, most stables and villages are
connected by well-traveled roads.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>From here, you can follow them west
to <clr:0000>Rito Village<clr:ffff> or east to <clr:0000>New Serenne
Stable<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>You often encounter <clr:0000>travelers<clr:ffff> on them,
eager to share their folksy knowledge,
and <clr:0000>merchants<clr:ffff> peddling their wares.
Talk18:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>♪Welcome to <clr:0000>Tabantha Bridge Stable<clr:ffff>.♪<sp:5:0:0>


Getting to hear the children perform with
the <clr:0000>Stable Trotters<clr:ffff> really does put a smile
on my face.
Near04: I hope he'll be all right...
Talk19:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>If you need the scoop on the area, just
leave it to Auntie!<sp:0:4:0>But please don't expect too much...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100>I mean, it's a remote western region.
When the Stable Trotters aren't around,
all you can hear is the bleating of goats.
Any news comes from travelers and
peddlers along the <clr:0000>road<clr:ffff>.
Talk06:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>From here, you could follow the main
road west to <clr:0000>Rito Village<clr:ffff> or east to
<clr:0000>New Serenne Stable<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>On the road, you'll find <clr:0000>travelers<clr:ffff> ready
to share their folksy knowledge and
<clr:0000>merchants<clr:ffff> peddling their wares.
Talk09:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Don't be a stranger now! Come by and
talk to me whenever you like.
